intro: Crotalaria stuhlmannii, commonly known as the yellow false flax, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant characterized by its yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is known for its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. Crotalaria stuhlmannii typically grows in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its seeds are often dispersed by wind, contributing to its wide distribution across its native range.
